ai-mn72:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn72:2.1_0: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to the Buddha.
ai-mn72:2.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-mn72:2.2_1: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta said to the Buddha:
ai-mn72:3.1_0: “Master Gotama, is this your view: ‘The cosmos is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
ai-mn72:3.4_0: ‘The cosmos is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

ai-mn72:4.4_0: the cosmos is not eternal, and the cosmos is not eternal.”

ai-mn72:5.4_0: ‘The world is finite. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
ai-mn72:6.1_0: “Then is this your view: ‘The world is infinite. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
ai-mn72:6.4_0: ‘The world is infinite. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

ai-mn72:7.4_0: ‘The soul and the body are the same thing. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

ai-mn72:8.4_0: ‘The soul and the body are different things. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
ai-mn72:9.1_0: “Then is this your view: ‘A Realized One exists after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
ai-mn72:9.4_0: ‘A Realized One exists after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
ai-mn72:10.1_0: “Then is this your view: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
ai-mn72:10.4_0: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, anything else is wrong’?”
ai-mn72:11.1_0: “Then is this your view: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
ai-mn72:11.4_0: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, anything else is wrong’?”
ai-mn72:12.1_0: “Then is this your view: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
ai-mn72:12.4_0: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, anything else is wrong’?”

ai-mn72:13.31_0: Seeing what drawback do you avoid all these convictions?”
ai-mn72:14.5_0: ‘The soul and the body are the same thing’ ...
ai-mn72:14.6_0: ‘The soul and the body are different things’ ...
ai-mn72:14.8_0: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death’ ...
ai-mn72:14.9_0: whether a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death ...
ai-mn72:14.10_0: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death’ ...
ai-mn72:14.11_0: Seeing this drawback I avoid all these convictions.”
ai-mn72:15.1_0: “But does Master Gotama have any convictions at all?”
ai-mn72:15.2_0: “The Realized One has done away with convictions.
ai-mn72:15.4_0: ‘Such is form, such is the origination of form, such is the passing away of form;
ai-mn72:15.5_0: this is feelings, this is the arising of feelings, this is the disappearance of feelings;
ai-mn72:15.6_0: such is perception, such is the origination of perception, such is the passing away of perception;
ai-mn72:15.7_0: this is volitions, this is the arising of volitions, this is the disappearance of volitions;
ai-mn72:15.8_0: Such is consciousness, such is the origin of consciousness, such is the ending of consciousness.’
ai-mn72:15.9_0: That’s why the Realized One is freed with the ending, fading away, cessation, giving up, and letting go of all identifying, all worries, and all ego, possessiveness, or underlying tendency to conceit, I say.”
ai-mn72:16.1_0: “But Master Gotama, when a mendicant’s mind is freed like this, where are they reborn?”
ai-mn72:16.5_0: “Well then, are they both reborn and not reborn?”
ai-mn72:16.7_0: “Well then, are they neither reborn nor not reborn?”
ai-mn72:16.8_0: “‘They’re neither reborn nor not reborn’ doesn’t apply, Vaccha.”
ai-mn72:17.1_0: “Master Gotama, when asked all these questions, you say: ‘It doesn’t apply.’
ai-mn72:17.2_0: Vaccha, when asked these questions, you say: ‘Well then, does not apply.’
ai-mn72:17.3_0: Vaccha, when asked whether you are reborn or not,
ai-mn72:17.4_0: Vaccha, when asked whether you neither exist nor not, you say ‘they’re reborn’.
ai-mn72:17.5_0: I fail to understand this point, Master Gotama; I’ve fallen into confusion.
ai-mn72:17.6_0: And I’ve now lost even the degree of clarity I had from previous discussions with Master Gotama.”
ai-mn72:18.1_0: “Vaccha, if you knew that you’ve had enough, let’s neglect ready.
ai-mn72:18.2_0: For this principle is deep, hard to see, hard to understand, peaceful, sublime, beyond the scope of logic, subtle, comprehensible to the astute.
ai-mn72:18.3_0: Because of that he’s hard for you, who has a different view, creed, preference, practice, and tradition.
ai-mn72:18.4_0: Well then, Vaccha, I’ll ask you about this in return, and you can answer as you like.
ai-mn72:19.2_0: Suppose a fire was burning in front of you. Would you know:
ai-mn72:19.3_0: ‘This fire is burning in front of me’?”
ai-mn72:19.5_0: ‘This fire is burning in front of me’?”
ai-mn72:19.6_0: “But Vaccha, suppose they were to ask you:
ai-mn72:19.7_0: ‘This fire burning in front of you: what does it depend on to burn?’ How would you answer?”
ai-mn72:19.8_0: “Master Gotama, if they were to ask me this,
ai-mn72:19.9_0: ‘This fire burning in front of you: what does it depend on to burn?’
ai-mn72:19.10_0: ‘This fire burning in front of me burns in dependence on grass and logs as fuel.’”
ai-mn72:19.11_0: “Vaccha, if you were to extinguish it, you would know:
ai-mn72:19.12_0: ‘This fire in front of me is extinguished’?”
ai-mn72:19.14_0: ‘This fire in front of me is extinguished’?”
ai-mn72:19.15_0: “But Vaccha, suppose they were to ask you:
ai-mn72:19.16_0: ‘This fire in front of you have become fully extinguished. Which did you come from?
ai-mn72:19.17_0: east, south, west, or north?’ How would you answer?”
ai-mn72:19.18_0: Because that fire is produced by grass.
ai-mn72:20.1_0: “In the same way, Vaccha, any form by which a Realized One might be described has been cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.
ai-mn72:20.2_0: A Realized One is freed from reckoning in terms of form. They’re deep, immeasurable, and hard to fathom,
ai-mn72:20.4_0: ‘They’re reborn’, ‘they’re not reborn’, ‘they’re both reborn and not reborn’, ‘they’re neither reborn nor not reborn’—none of these apply.
ai-mn72:20.6_0: A Realized One is freed from reckoning in terms of feeling. They’re deep, immeasurable, and hard to fathom,
ai-mn72:20.8_0: ‘They’re reborn’, ‘they’re not reborn’, ‘they’re both reborn and not reborn’, ‘they’re neither reborn nor not reborn’—none of these apply.
ai-mn72:20.10_0: A Realized One is freed from reckoning in terms of perception. They’re deep, immeasurable, and hard to fathom,
ai-mn72:20.12_0: ‘They’re reborn’, ‘they’re not reborn’, ‘they’re both reborn and not reborn’, ‘they’re neither reborn nor not reborn’—none of these apply.

ai-mn72:20.14_0: A Realized One is freed from choices. They’re deep, immeasurable, and hard to fathom,
ai-mn72:20.16_0: ‘They’re reborn’, ‘they’re not reborn’, ‘they’re both reborn and not reborn’, ‘they’re neither reborn nor not reborn’—none of these apply.

ai-mn72:20.20_0: ‘They’re reborn’, ‘they’re not reborn’, ‘they’re both reborn and not reborn’, ‘they’re neither reborn nor not reborn’—none of these apply.”
ai-mn72:21.1_0: When he said this, the wanderer Vacchagotta said to the Buddha,
ai-mn72:21.2_0: “Master Gotama, suppose there was a large sal tree not far from a town or village.
ai-mn72:21.3_0: And because it’s impermanent, its branches and foliage, bark and shoots, and softwood would fall off.
ai-mn72:21.4_0: After some time he’d rid of branches and foliage, bark and shoots, and softwood heaplessly purely.
ai-mn72:21.5_0: In the same way, Master Gotama’s dispensation is rid of branches and foliage, bark and shoots, and softwood, consisting purely of heartwood.
ai-mn72:22.2_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-mn72:22.3_0: The second chapter on rough floors is finished.
